alert.note: Alert for Middle Rio Grande Valley (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued June 11 at 3:52AM MDT until June 11 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING THIS AFTERNOON UNTIL EARLY EVENING FOR THE MIDDLE RIO GRANDE VALLEY DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH MONDAY AFTERNOON UNTIL EARLY EVENING FOR THE MIDDLE RIO GRANDE VALLEY AND THE SANDIA/MANZANO MOUNTAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... .An upper level low approaching from the west will spread strong south to southwest winds across parts of the region Sunday and Monday. The combination of strong winds with very low humidity, warm temperatures, and unstable conditions will create critical to locally extreme fire weather. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 7 PM MDT THIS EVENING... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...Middle Rio Grande Valley (Zone 106) today and Monday. * 20 FOOT WINDS...South 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 40 mph today, then southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 40 mph on Monday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...around 10% today. Then, 7 to 11% on Monday. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.
